job_title: Anonymous Employee in Niagara Falls, NY
pros: The people that survive the politics are quite amazing.
cons: Worst place to work. Administration is nothing but bullies. They treat their employees like garbage and when they stand up for themselves they're ultimately fired or pushed to quitting. If they don't like you. they will do everything to get rid of you. There's a bunch of cliques within the organization and if you're not part of one of them you're not safe. If you're black, brown or anything other than white. Hang it up!!!

job_title: Health Home Care Manager in Niagara Falls, NY
pros: Significant time off accrual for sick leave, vacation, and holidays.
cons: Holidays are taken out of your time off bank. Employees have to pay for parking in the parking garage. The company is very money driven and the focus was always on quantity of billable services instead of the quality of services provided.

job_title: Director in Niagara Falls, NY
pros: There is always opportunity for OT. The CNO has no idea what she is doing so plenty of chances to pick up shifts because they don’t know how to schedule correctly. Always short staffed. Fire at will. Major culture issues. Scary place to work.
cons: C-Suite is stuck in the 90’s. Nursing Leader CNO is insecure. Always firing people. Uses intimidation to get you to work shifts your not hired for.

review_title: Program Aide on Adolescent Psychiatric Unit
job_title: Prograim Aide in Niagara Falls, NY
pros: This position was very rewarding. It was possible to see the impact that I had on a patient by the end of a shift, sometimes. Other times, no change was evident but then they would write a letter or confide in another staff member how much they had been helped. It was good to know that their lives were being improved by our efforts.
cons: The patients could be very unruly, at times. The staff often fought over overtime. I avoided that as much as possible, so it didn't have a very negative impact on my time there. It's also possible to be called to the adult unit, during a rapid response, and the adult patients are less composed that the adolescents, so it was a very different environment. Usually, people that prefer the adolescent unit don't like the adult unit and vice versa.
